headline: Boeing delivered its fewest planes in years. Recovering from the strike will take weeks
summary: A week after Boeing machinists ended an almost two-month strike, the aerospace manufacturer said Tuesday that October saw it deliver the smallest number of planes in years.

headline: Boeing Stock Is Down Again. Here Are the Reasons Investors Should Pay Attention To.
summary: Boeing  stock slid again Tuesday, but not all the reasons for the drop are good ones.  There are a few potential factors causing investors to feel increasingly nervous after getting—ostensibly—good news with the ending of the company’s contentious labor strike.  But what investors really should be focusing on are two other issues: U.S.-China tensions and Boeing’s stock chart.

headline: Boeing October deliveries hit low after strike
summary: Boeing’s (BA) October performance has taken a downturn, with just 14 aircraft delivered — its lowest monthly total since November 2020. The drop comes after a seven-week strike by over 32,000 machinists, which disrupted operations and production. Yahoo Finance’s Seana Smith, Jared Blikre, and Brad Smith break down what this means for Boeing’s long-term deliveries and the impact the delays are having on airline companies like Southwest (LUV) and United Airlines (UAL) that are facing the challenges of postponed aircraft arrivals. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here. This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: Boeing: Air Cargo Traffic to Double by 2043 as Emerging Markets Drive Growth
summary: With a strong air cargo market exceeding pre-pandemic levels, Boeing [NYSE: BA] forecasts continued long-term growth, saying air cargo traffic will increase by an average of 4% per year through 2043. These projections appear in Boeing's 2024 World Air Cargo Forecast (WACF), the biennial overview and long-term outlook for the air cargo industry.

headline: Boeing strike sinks October deliveries to 14 jets
summary: Boeing said on Tuesday it delivered 14 commercial jets in October, less than half of the 34 jets it handed over to customers during the same month in 2023, after a weeks-long strike halted most of its aircraft production.  Boeing is facing heightened oversight by the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) as it resumes output of its strongest-selling 737 MAX jets, along with 767, 777 and 777x models, after their production was halted during the strike which started on Sept. 12.  Boeing 787 production in South Carolina was not affected by the strike.

raw.headline: Boeing strike sinks October deliveries to 14 jets

Boeing is facing heightened oversight by the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) as it resumes output of its strongest-selling 737 MAX jets, along with 767, 777 and 777x models, after their production was halted during the strike which started on Sept. 12.  Boeing 787 production in South Carolina was not affected by the strike.

headline: Boeing got the easy part done. Now comes the tougher, existential problems
summary: Boeing’s most immediate problem – an eight-week strike by 33,000 workers – is over. But its more serious problems – ongoing massive losses, quality and safety problems – are as bad as ever, and could even get worse.

raw.headline: Boeing got the easy part done. Now comes the tougher, existential problems
raw.summary: Boeing’s most immediate problem – an eight-week strike by 33,000 workers – is over. But its more serious problems – ongoing massive losses, quality and safety problems – are as bad as ever, and could even get worse.

headline: Boeing says it will take several weeks to resume production of planes after the strike
summary: Boeing says it will be several weeks before it fully resumes building passenger planes, as factory workers return following a strike that lasted nearly two months.  A Boeing spokesperson said Tuesday that the delay in restarting plants in Washington state and Oregon is due to multiple steps needed to resume production.  Airline customers have grown increasingly upset over delays in getting new planes from Boeing — delays that started long before 33,000 machinists went on strike Sept. 13.

headline: Spirit Aero gets planemaker help to prop up weak finances
summary: (Reuters) -Spirit AeroSystems said on Tuesday it would receive up to $350 million in advance payments from its largest customer Boeing, giving the struggling supplier a lifeline as it burns cash after four consecutive years of losses.  The Wichita, Kansas-based aerostructures giant is also on the verge of an agreement for a smaller amount of fresh funding and revised payment terms with Boeing's European rival Airbus, a source familiar with the matter said.  Plans for a funding agreement with Boeing, first reported last week by Reuters, come days after Spirit issued a "going concern" warning - effectively putting investors on notice that it may be unable to pay its bills within the next 12 months.

raw.headline: Spirit Aero gets planemaker help to prop up weak finances
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Spirit AeroSystems said on Tuesday it would receive up to $350 million in advance payments from its largest customer Boeing, giving the struggling supplier a lifeline as it burns cash after four consecutive years of losses.  The Wichita, Kansas-based aerostructures giant is also on the verge of an agreement for a smaller amount of fresh funding and revised payment terms with Boeing's European rival Airbus, a source familiar with the matter said.  Plans for a funding agreement with Boeing, first reported last week by Reuters, come days after Spirit issued a "going concern" warning - effectively putting investors on notice that it may be unable to pay its bills within the next 12 months.

headline: Boeing Lands 737-8 Deal With Avia Solutions: 40 Planes Now, 40 More To Follow
summary: Boeing Company (NYSE:BA) disclosed an initial order from Avia Solutions Group for 40 of its 737-8 aircraft, with an option to purchase an additional 40 in the future. Avia Solutions Group holds 11 air operator certificates, including Avion Express and Smartlynx, serving airlines and tour operators in over 60 countries year-round. The 737-8 is a single-aisle aircraft that seats 162 to 210 passengers and has a range of up to 3,500 nautical miles (6,480 km), depending on its configuration. Brad McM

headline: Millennium Spacecraft for NASA TRACERS Mission Moves to Testing Phase
summary: Millennium Space Systems, a Boeing (NYSE: BA) company, completed two spacecraft for NASA's Tandem Reconnection and Cusp Electrodynamics Reconnaissance Satellites, or TRACERS, mission, which will measure the connection between solar wind and the magnetic field surrounding Earth.

headline: Avia orders 40 Boeing 737 MAX jets
summary: The 40 jets will be valued at about $2.17 billion, according to Reuters calculations based on estimated delivery prices from Cirium Ascend.  Avia Solutions which has 11 air operator certificates expects delivery of 737 MAX jets to start in 2030.  Production delays by aircraft manufacturers have boosted carriers' demand for leased planes to meet a spike in travel demand.
